Detailed Description

Some functions to set lights and its propierties, to draw polygons, configure the rear plane, etc...

enum NE_CULLING_ENUM

Used in NE_PolyFormat(). Tells what polygons to draw.

Enumerator:
NE_CULL_FRONT  Don't draw polygons looking at the camera.
NE_CULL_BACK  Don't draw polygons not looking at the camera.
NE_CULL_NONE  Draw all polygons polygon.

enum NE_LIGHT_ENUM

Used in NE_PolyFormat(). Tells what lights to use.

Enumerator:
NE_LIGHT_0  Use light 0.
NE_LIGHT_1  Use light 1.
NE_LIGHT_2  Use light 2.
NE_LIGHT_3  Use light 3.
NE_LIGHT_01  Use lights 0 and 1.
NE_LIGHT_02  Use lights 0 and 2.
NE_LIGHT_03  Use lights 0 and 3.
NE_LIGHT_12  Use lights 1 and 2.
NE_LIGHT_13  Use lights 1 and 3.
NE_LIGHT_23  Use lights 2 and 3.
NE_LIGHT_012  Use lights 0, 1 and 2.
NE_LIGHT_013  Use lights 0, 1 and 3.
NE_LIGHT_023  Use lights 0, 2 and 3.
NE_LIGHT_123  Use lights 1, 2 and 3.
NE_LIGHT_0123  Use all lights.
NE_LIGHT_ALL  Use all lights.

enum NE_OTHER_FORMAT_ENUM

Used in NE_PolyFormat().

Enumerator:
NE_MODULATION  Normal shading.
NE_TOON_SHADING  Toon shading.
NE_USE_FOG  Use fog.

Function Documentation

void NE_ClearBMPEnable ( bool  value  )  [inline]

Set clear bitmap on/off.

Parameters:
value True/false for on/off.
It uses VRAM_C as color bitmap and VRAM_D as depth bitmap. You have to copy data there and then use this function. Those 2 VRAM banks can't be used as texture banks with this enabled, so you have to call NE_TextureSystemReset(0,0,USE_VRAM_AB); before using this.

Dual 3D mode needs those two banks for the display capture, so you can't use a clear BMP.

VRAM_C: ABBBBBGGGGGRRRRR -- Alpha - Blue - Green - Red VRAM_D: FDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD -- Fog - Depth (0 = near, 0x7FFF = far)

Use this only if you really need it. If you want to display just an image, set the rear plane alpha to 0 with NE_ClearColorSet() and use a simple background. This is meant to be used only if you need to set different depths to every pixel or enable the fog for just some pixels.

void NE_ClearBMPScroll ( u8  x,
u8  y 
) [inline]

Sets scroll of clear BMP. (0 - 255).

Parameters:
x Scroll on the X axis.
y Scroll on the Y axis.

void NE_FogEnable ( u8  shift,
u32  color,
u8  alpha,
int  mass,
int  depth 
)

Enables fog and sets its parameters.

Parameters:
shift Distance between fog bands. (1 - 15)
color Fog color.
alpha Alpha value.
mass Quantity of fog.
depth Start point of fog. (0 - 7FFFh) [Use float_to_12d3(n) int_to_12d3(n) ?]
You should try different values until you find the configuration you like.

void NE_FogEnableBackground ( bool  value  )  [inline]

Enable/disable background fog (doesn't affect polygons).

Parameters:
value True/false for on/off.

void NE_OutliningEnable ( bool  value  )  [inline]

Enable/disable outlining.

Parameters:
value True/False for enabling/disabling.
You have to set some colors for this with NE_OutliningSetColor(). Color 0 works with polygon IDs 0 - 7, color 1 with IDs 8 - 15... 8 colors available. Only works with opaque or wireframe polygons.

void NE_OutliningSetColor ( u8  num,
u32  color 
) [inline]

Set outlining color.

Parameters:
num Color number.
color Color.

void NE_PolyBegin ( int  mode  )  [inline]

Begin a polygon.

Parameters:
mode Type of polygon to draw (GL_TRIANGLE, GL_QUAD...).

void NE_PolyColor ( u32  color  )  [inline]

Set color for next group of vertex.

void NE_PolyFormat ( u8  alpha,
u8  id,
NE_LIGHT_ENUM  lights,
NE_CULLING_ENUM  culling,
NE_OTHER_FORMAT_ENUM  other 
) [inline]

Enable/disable multiple options.

Parameters:
alpha Alpha value. 0 = Wireframe, 31 = Opaque, 1-30 Transparent. You can only blend one polygon over another if they have different ID.
id Polygon ID used for antialias, blending and outlining. (0 - 63)
lights Lights used... Use NE_LIGHT_ENUM for this.
culling What polygons must not be drawn. Possible options in NE_CULLING_ENUM.
other Other parameters. Possible flags in NE_OTHER_FORMAT_ENUM.

void NE_PolyTexCoord ( int  u,
int  v 
) [inline]

Set texture coordinates.

Parameters:
u (u,v) Texture coordinates (0 - texturesize).
v (u,v) Texture coordinates (0 - texturesize).
"When texture mapping, the Geometry Engine works faster if you issue commands in the order TexCoord -> Normal -> Vertex." http://nocash.emubase.de/gbatek.htm#ds3dtextureattributes

void NE_ShadingEnable ( bool  value  ) 

Set shading on/off.

Parameters:
value Truefalse for on/off.
Change propierties of materials affected by this to, for example: AMBIENT = RGB15(8,8,8), DIFFUSE = RGB15(24,24,24), SPECULAR = 0, EMISSION = 0
